frame.name: Corporal_punishment
frame.definition:
<def-root>Blend of Rewards_and_punishments and Bodily_injury in which the <fen>Agent</fen> performs some action intended to cause Bodily harm to the <fen>Evaluee</fen> as a consequence of some action or belief of the Evaluee (the <fen>Reason</fen>).
<ex><fex name="Evaluee">The Sheriff</fex> <t>flogged</t> <fex name="Agent">him</fex> <fex name="Reason">for his crimes</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The instrument with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward. <ex>The emperor <t>flogged</t> her <fex name="Means">by taking one of the stays to her</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. <ex>John <t>caned</t> the criminal <fex name="Purp">to set an example</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evaluee
FE.definition: <def-root>Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this FE is typically expressed as Object: <ex><fex name="Evaluee">You</fex> will be <t>flogged</t> for your actions.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g. <ex>The Sheriff <t>flogged</t> him <fex name="Reason">for his crimes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action</def-root>

FE.name: Severity
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element marks a quantity related to the seriousness of the punished behavior. <ex>Mr. Devine could face <fex name="Severity">up to 300</fex> <t>lashes</t> for the offense.</ex></def-root>
